conclusion: Analyze the behavior of light as it enters and exits the semi-cylindrical object to find the refractive index.
Light enters the semi-cylindrical object at point C, distance \(\frac{\sqrt{3}}{3}R\) from center O, travels towards point B on the curved surface, and refracts outwards.
The radius of the semi-cylinder is \(R\) and distance \(OC\) is \(\frac{\sqrt{3}}{3}R\).
Using the Pythagorean theorem in triangle OBC, find \(BC = \frac{\sqrt{6}}{3}R\).
The light exits the semi-cylinder at B and refracts outwards.
Since no light is emitted from the right side, \(\theta_r = 0\), making \(\theta_i\) the critical angle \(\theta_c\).
The critical angle \(\theta_c\) is given by \(\sin(\theta_c) = \frac{1}{n}\).
